quiz.question: Which girl is younger?

answers.description: Portrait of Helene Fourment in a Fur Wrap (1638), Peter Paul Rubens
Portrait of Anna Akhmatova (1914), Nathan Altman.

quiz.textCorrect: Correct! This lady is a bit younger than the other. She is the beloved wife of a very rich man who is passionately in love with her figure. 17th century Bodypositive!
quiz.textIncorrect: In fact this lady is but one year older than the other. She is much skinnier, though. Maybe a Soviet poetess was fed less than a Flemish aristocrat’s wife. However, the world is so beautiful because we all are so different!

quiz.question: Which man is older?

answers.description: Self-portrait at the Age of 63 (1669), Rembrandt

quiz.textCorrect: Seems like time has more mercy nowadays than it had in the 17th century. In this picture Henri Matisse is 19 years older than Rembrandt, making him 82.
quiz.textIncorrect: He is only 63! In some countries he would not yet have reached retirement age. The man in the other picture is 82.

quiz.question: These are pictures by (and of) the same artist. Which of these was drawn earlier?
quiz.textCorrect: Obviously! It is Pablo Picasso at the age of 25. In the other picture he is 56.
quiz.textIncorrect: Oh no! It is 56 year old Picasso! 31 years older than in the other picture.

quiz.question: These are pictures of two different artists. Which artist was older than the other at the time it was made?

answers.description: Saint Francis of Assisi in Ecstasy (c.1595), Caravaggio

quiz.textCorrect: Matisse was 80 when he made this artwork. It would take more than two lifetimes for Caravaggio to reach that age.
quiz.textIncorrect: Caravaggio started working early. This picture was made at the age of 24. The other picture was made by Matisse at the age of 80.

quiz.question: Which painting is bigger in real life?
quiz.textCorrect: This artwork looks even more fascinating in real life because it is 4 square meters (13 sq ft)! It is impossible to feel this awe until you see it.
quiz.textIncorrect: Surprisingly, this highly realistic and detailed picture is only about 1 square meter (3 sq ft).

quiz.question: Which of these pictures is a self-portrait?

answers.description: The Son of Man (1946), Rene Magritte
The Pleasure Principle (Portrait of Edward James) (1937), Rene Magritte

quiz.textCorrect: Of course you are right! Who could doubt this is Magritte himself!
quiz.textIncorrect: No way! The face bears no resemblance to Rene Magritte!

quiz.question: These are the original picture and an edited copy. Which one is upside down?

answers.description: Color Study: Squares With Concentric Circles (1913), Wassily Kandinsky
Black Square and Red Square (1915), Kasimir Malevich

quiz.textCorrect: Obvious! This one is upside down!
quiz.textIncorrect: Not this picture. One day, people will memorize Malevich’s artworks. Just not today.

quiz.question: Which one is about love?

answers.description: An Allegory of Venus and Cupid (c. 1545), Angolo Bronzino

quiz.textCorrect: Right! This painting is about love, which has two sides from a philosophical perspective. It can be tender but can also cause trouble. Just look at the guy on the middle-left side. Supposedly he has syphilis. Oh, the deceits of love!
quiz.textIncorrect: In fact this is more about war. Judith seduced an enemy of her fellow’s to cut his head off while he was sleeping.

quiz.question: Which one of these drawings was created by a robot?
quiz.textCorrect: Yep, a robot made this. You can see how it was built and how it draws here: https://habrahabr.ru/sandbox/70548/
quiz.textIncorrect: Contemporary art is so contemporary. This is a picture by a talented human artist.

quiz.question: Which one is about morning?
quiz.textCorrect: You are a genius! It is a morning scene indeed.
quiz.textIncorrect: Not exactly. The author called it evening.

quiz.question: Which one of these is a self-portrait?

answers.description: Self-Portrait in Red and Gold Dress (1941), Frida Kahlo

quiz.textCorrect: No doubt - it is in her unique style! That’s how Frida saw herself.
quiz.textIncorrect: Beauty is in the eye of the beholder. It is a painting by Diego Rivera.

quiz.question: Which one of these was made by an animal?
quiz.textCorrect: Correct! It was made by an elephant from Samutprakarn Zoo, Thailand.
quiz.textIncorrect: No and no! It is the work of the famous contemporary artist Cy Twombly.

quiz.question: One of these is about pain and one is about pleasure. Who is having a good time?

answers.description: Bather stretched out on the ground (1886-1888) Edgar Degas

quiz.textCorrect: That’s true, the girl is enjoying an after-bath nap.
quiz.textIncorrect: A little mistake, he is dying.

quiz.question: Which of these paintings was created by a famous musician?

answers.description: Edvard Munch: Death and the Child, 1899

quiz.textCorrect: It was made by the great musician David Bowie! Peace to you.
quiz.textIncorrect: Not exactly. It is picture of Munch, not Bowie!However eccentric Edvard Munch was, he’d never played a guitar.

result.title: An Easel
result.text: Hey, we all start somewhere. Years ago an easel was a tree. Don’t give up!

result.title: Drunk Artist
result.text: You can tell a Picasso by touch, but spill wine on it in the process.

result.title: Art Thief
result.text: You are talented enough to spot the one good picture in the room. You might as well steal them all, just in case you’re wrong.

result.title: Unemployed Museum Curator
result.text: You were good at your job. It’s just one day you hung your boss’s drawing upside down.

result.title: Art Teacher
result.text: Or maybe you work at Icons8.

result.title: Oracle
result.text: Either this is your 14th attempt or you are reading this message with your eyes closed. Taking a shower. 20 years ago.

metaTags.description: How well do you know visual arts? You can check it right here!
